name: Abduction
text:
Enchant creature
When Abduction enters the battlefield, untap enchanted creature.
You control enchanted creature.
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

flavor:
I'm too modest a wizard to reveal the full extent of my abilities."
—Ertai, wizard adept
name: Abeyance
text:
Until end of turn, target player can't cast instant or sorcery spells, and that player can't activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.
Draw a card.
title: Abeyance

flavor: Mirri's hackles rose as Ertai continued expounding his virtues. "If that arrogant brat doesn't shut up soon," she growled to herself, "I'm going to have to kill him.
name: Abjure
text:
As an additional cost to cast Abjure, sacrifice a blue permanent.
Counter target spell.
title: Abjure

flavor: The Weatherlight banked sharply as the colossal beast rose up to crush the lone rider. "My bet's on the dirt," Gerrard said flatly.
name: Aboroth
text: Cumulative upkeep—Put a -1/-1 counter on Aboroth. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
title: Aboroth

flavor:
There are two ways for me to pass this gate. One involves you remaining conscious."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

flavor:
You can't get there from here. Well, you can—it just won't be fun."
—Ertai, wizard adept

An innocent man died because of my anger. That knowledge will haunt me for all eternity."

Flying

Helping people is mostly a matter of teaching them to help themselves."

Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

When Ancestral Knowledge leaves the battlefield, shuffle your library.

text: Whenever a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may sacrifice Angelic Renewal. If you do, return that card to the battlefield.

Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may discard a card at random. If he or she does, untap that creature.

No matter where we cat warriors go in the world, those stupid slobberers find us."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

While the rest of us got paid to serve the Benalish army, the militia didn't. I used to say they stood for freedom—free and dumb."

We often bury our pasts, and then someone comes along and digs them up."

Flying

flavor: The necratog can always dig up a meal.

text: Exile the top creature card of your graveyard: Necratog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
title: Necratog

name: Noble Benefactor
text: When Noble Benefactor dies, each player may search his or her library for a card and put that card into his or her hand. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.
title: Noble Benefactor

flavor:
Gerrard: "But it doesn't do anything!"
Hanna: "No—it does nothing.
name: Null Rod
text: Activated abilities of artifacts can't be activated.
title: Null Rod

flavor: By the time you've seen it, you won't remember that you did.
name: Odylic Wraith
text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Whenever Odylic Wraith deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
title: Odylic Wraith

name: Ophidian
text: Whenever Ophidian attacks and isn't blocked, you may draw a card. If you do, Ophidian assigns no combat damage this turn.
title: Ophidian

flavor: They wouldn't know their house from a charred hole in the ground.
name: Orcish Settlers
text: {X}{X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Orcish Settlers: Destroy X target lands.
title: Orcish Settlers

flavor:
Barrin always said that reality is relative. ‘The world,' he cautioned, ‘is but pieces of one's perception.'"
—Ertai, wizard adept
name: Paradigm Shift
text: Exile all cards from your library. Then shuffle your graveyard into your library.
title: Paradigm Shift

flavor:
I have always imagined my mother as such a woman, strong and wise."
—Sisay, journal
name: Peacekeeper
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Peacekeeper unless you pay {1}{W}.
Creatures can't attack.
title: Peacekeeper

flavor: As insubstantial—and as insistent—as appetite.
name: Pendrell Mists
text: All creatures have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature unless you pay {1}.
title: Pendrell Mists

flavor:
Fishtails infest the water, and mists walk the land. Give me simple solid rock any day."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
name: Phantom Warrior
text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
title: Phantom Warrior

flavor: But you said ‘when goats fly!'" Squee whined.
name: Phantom Wings
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Sacrifice Phantom Wings: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.
title: Phantom Wings

name: Phyrexian Furnace
text:
{T}: Exile the bottom card of target player's graveyard.
{1}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Furnace: Exile target card from a graveyard. Draw a card.
title: Phyrexian Furnace

flavor:
Tolaria floats upon a wheel of fortune."
—Ertai, wizard adept
name: Psychic Vortex
text:
Cumulative upkeep—Draw a card. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of your end step, sacrifice a land and discard your hand.
title: Psychic Vortex

flavor:
Men and rats both hunger: we for our playthings; they, for us."
—Crovax
name: Razortooth Rats
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
title: Razortooth Rats

flavor:
In the heart of Llanowar the magic is so strong that trees cannot stay rooted."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight
name: Redwood Treefolk
title: Redwood Treefolk

flavor:
Barrin taught me that the hardest lessons to grasp are the ones you've already learned."
—Ertai, wizard adept
name: Relearn
text: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
title: Relearn

flavor:
I felt unworthy even to dream of it."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
name: Revered Unicorn
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When Revered Unicorn leaves the battlefield, you gain life equal to the number of age counters on it.
title: Revered Unicorn

name: Roc Hatchling
text:
Roc Hatchling enters the battlefield with four shell counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a shell counter from Roc Hatchling.
As long as Roc Hatchling has no shell counters on it, it gets +3/+2 and has flying.
title: Roc Hatchling

flavor:
When are trees like grass?"
—The One Thousand Questions
name: Rogue Elephant
text: When Rogue Elephant enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice a Forest.
title: Rogue Elephant

flavor: The owl asks but never answers.
name: Sage Owl
text:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
title: Sage Owl

flavor: You will sharpen your teeth on my enemies' bones," Maraxus promised them, and his ogres cheered.
name: Sawtooth Ogre
text: Whenever Sawtooth Ogre blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Sawtooth Ogre deals 1 damage to that creature at end of combat.
title: Sawtooth Ogre

name: Scorched Ruins
text:
If Scorched Ruins would enter the battlefield, sacrifice two untapped lands instead. If you do, put Scorched Ruins onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C}{C} to your mana pool.
title: Scorched Ruins

flavor:
Just think of me as the storm before the calm."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
name: Serenity
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy all artifacts and enchantments. They can't be regenerated.
title: Serenity

flavor:
I have seen your strength imbued in angels' wings, and I have felt your sorrow rain down on the ruins brought by the Lord of the Wastes."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
name: Serra's Blessing
text: Creatures you control have vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause them to tap.)
title: Serra's Blessing

flavor:
Whereas I was created to protect, the biskelion was created to destroy."
—Karn, silver golem
name: Serrated Biskelion
text: {T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on Serrated Biskelion and a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
title: Serrated Biskelion

flavor: In its world of complete darkness, it has no shadows to fear.
name: Shadow Rider
text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
title: Shadow Rider

flavor:
You must be mad to want one such as I aboard the Weatherlight. But I would be mad to remain here with my rotting family. I accept."
—Crovax
name: Shattered Crypt
text: Return X target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand. You lose X life.
title: Shattered Crypt

flavor:
The sidar who raised me had a saying: ‘The first step into death is the hardest.'"
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
name: Soul Shepherd
text: {W}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: You gain 1 life.
title: Soul Shepherd

flavor:
Look to the south; there you will find peace and serenity."
—The Book of Tal
name: Southern Paladin
text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target red permanent.
title: Southern Paladin

name: Spinning Darkness
text:
You may exile the top three black cards of your graveyard rather than pay Spinning Darkness's mana cost.
Spinning Darkness deals 3 damage to target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
title: Spinning Darkness

flavor:
Although I would give my life to protect Gerrard, my conscience will not let me take another's. There are many who would not hesitate."
—Karn, silver golem
name: Steel Golem
text: You can't cast creature spells.
title: Steel Golem

flavor:
I have seen the night torn into thin darkling strips and woven into shapes too bleak for dreams."
—Crovax
name: Strands of Night
text: {B}{B}, Pay 2 life, Sacrifice a Swamp: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
title: Strands of Night

flavor:
Don't look at me. I didn't build it."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
name: Straw Golem
text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, sacrifice Straw Golem.
title: Straw Golem

flavor:
The bear is never cautious—which is why it wasn't born a human."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight
name: Striped Bears
text: When Striped Bears enters the battlefield, draw a card.
title: Striped Bears

name: Sylvan Hierophant
text: When Sylvan Hierophant dies, exile Sylvan Hierophant, then return another target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
title: Sylvan Hierophant

name: Tariff
text: Each player sacrifices the creature he or she controls with the highest converted mana cost unless he or she pays that creature's mana cost. If two or more creatures a player controls are tied for highest cost, that player chooses one.
title: Tariff

flavor:
I don't like to speak ill of 'walkers . . . but just what did Teferi think he was doing?"
—Ertai, wizard adept
name: Teferi's Veil
text: Whenever a creature you control attacks, it phases out at end of combat. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
title: Teferi's Veil

flavor:
Because I am incapable of tears does not mean I have no need to shed them."
—Karn, silver golem
name: Tendrils of Despair
text:
As an additional cost to cast Tendrils of Despair, sacrifice a creature.
Target opponent discards two cards.
title: Tendrils of Despair

flavor: This will work," Gerrard called to the elves as he used the forge to strengthen the aboroth, "but if it doesn't, we won't survive to care.
name: Thran Forge
text: {2}: Until end of turn, target nonartifact creature gets +1/+0 and becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.
title: Thran Forge

flavor: Every line holds a tale, and between lie a thousand more.
name: Thran Tome
text: {5}, {T}: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Target opponent chooses one of those cards. Put that card into your graveyard, then draw two cards.
title: Thran Tome

flavor:
Most wizards consider a thunderbolt to be a proper retort."
—Ertai, wizard adept
name: Thunderbolt
text:
Choose one —
• Thunderbolt deals 3 damage to target player.
• Thunderbolt deals 4 damage to target creature with flying.
title: Thunderbolt

flavor: Its hooves strike lightning and the thunder follows quickly after.
name: Thundermare
text:
Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
When Thundermare enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.
title: Thundermare

flavor:
I sneezed, and it bolted."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
name: Timid Drake
text:
Flying
When another creature enters the battlefield, return Timid Drake to its owner's hand.
title: Timid Drake

flavor: Many have been lost just in staring at its wings. What's seen differs from account to account, but madness is always part of the story.
name: Tolarian Drake
text:
Flying
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
title: Tolarian Drake

flavor:
Why should I boast? The bards will do it for me—and with music."
—Ertai, wizard adept
name: Tolarian Entrancer
text: Whenever Tolarian Entrancer becomes blocked by a creature, gain control of that creature at end of combat.
title: Tolarian Entrancer

flavor:
When the fishtails' threats of magic didn't move me, they set their pet on us."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
name: Tolarian Serpent
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put the top seven cards of your library into your graveyard.
title: Tolarian Serpent

flavor:
One touch to the stone and the sidar's son turned me from stalwart to statue."
—Karn, silver golem
name: Touchstone
text: {T}: Tap target artifact you don't control.
title: Touchstone

flavor:
Even the fiercest storm has a peaceful eye."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator
name: Tranquil Grove
text: {1}{G}{G}: Destroy all other enchantments.
title: Tranquil Grove

flavor:
The Uktabi efreet and I have something in common: both of our mothers wanted to give us back."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight
name: Uktabi Efreet
text: Cumulative upkeep {G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
title: Uktabi Efreet

flavor:
It is a narrow line between justice and vengeance."
—Crovax
name: Urborg Justice
text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature for each creature put into your graveyard from the battlefield this turn.
title: Urborg Justice

flavor:
May you be a stalker's dream."
—Urborg curse
name: Urborg Stalker
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player controls a nonblack, nonland permanent, Urborg Stalker deals 1 damage to that player.
title: Urborg Stalker

name: Veteran Explorer
text: When Veteran Explorer dies, each player may search his or her library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.
title: Veteran Explorer

flavor:
After waking to the magic of Llanowar, no dreams can compare."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight
name: Vitalize
text: Untap all creatures you control.
title: Vitalize

flavor:
Torahn gore these shifty fishtails! You can't even get close to one."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
name: Vodalian Illusionist
text: {U}{U}, {T}: Target creature phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)
title: Vodalian Illusionist

flavor:
I'm always a little leery of anyone who offers to kill other people for free."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
name: Volunteer Reserves
text:
Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
title: Volunteer Reserves

flavor: The sea of fear has endless depths.
name: Wave of Terror
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of your draw step, destroy each creature with converted mana cost equal to the number of age counters on Wave of Terror. They can't be regenerated.
title: Wave of Terror

name: Well of Knowledge
text: {2}: Draw a card. Any player may activate this ability but only during his or her draw step.
title: Well of Knowledge

name: Winding Canyons
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Until end of turn, you may play creature cards as though they had flash.
title: Winding Canyons

flavor:
Until you have lived as a statue, do not talk to me of pigeons."
—Karn, silver golem
name: Xanthic Statue
text: {5}: Until end of turn, Xanthic Statue becomes an 8/8 Golem artifact creature with trample.
title: Xanthic Statue

flavor:
Pick a shell upon my shore and put it to your ear. That sound isn't the sea, but the whispers of the fallen."
—Crovax
name: Zombie Scavengers
text: Exile the top creature card of your graveyard: Regenerate Zombie Scavengers.
title: Zombie Scavengers
